sense.name: make or become less tight, dense or entangled
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] LOOSEN NP2[theme[concrete] NP1[theme] LOOSEN Includes: LOOSEN UP
sense.examples: The victim had loosened the front of two chains that secured the load. We loosened the vertical bolts that tighten the rail and injector stacks a bit. I loosened the roots some, but did not want to be too aggressive. Lloyd loosened his grip on the left arm rest and brought his hand to his damp forehead.

sense.name: make or become less strict or severe
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] LOOSEN NP2[theme[abstract]] NP1[theme] LOOSEN NOTE: compare carefully to sense 1; this sense implies a lessening of control and increased freedom Includes: LOOSEN UP, LOOSEN REINS, LOOSEN PURSE STRINGS
sense.examples: It was only a matter of time before she loosened the grip that TV had on her. If phone network providers loosened the reins it would stimulate development. As the state's purse strings loosened, the social complexion of science altered. The rules loosened up a good bit but many regulations that seem archaic today hung on.

sense.name: (cause to) relax, be at ease, assume a friendly manner
sense.examples: Loosen up, will you? Social activities allow people to get to know each other and to loosen up after a long day of work. I think having a band really has revitalized him and loosened him up. He went back to his corner and burst out laughing, and it loosened him up.

sense.name: become physically limber
sense.examples: A massage is a great way to loosen up after a long plane ride. This stretch is good to help loosen up after a long night's sleep and can help prepare you for any sports activity.
